plot: Without one eccentric first-generation Jewish immigrant from Transylvania, the New York City Marathon simply wouldn't exist. Ehrlich's fun, loving, and inspirational tribute to the late Fred Lebow shows how one man's imagination, determination, and love for running created one of the world's most popular sporting events.   Written by  Tribeca Film Festival
title: Run for Your Life
plot_es: Without one eccentric first-generation Jewish immigrant from Transylvania, the New York City Marathon simply wouldn't exist.
